# Prof. Coluci's Webpage


::: {.centerText}
![](vitor_coluci.jpg){width=20%}
:::


Prof. Coluci is an associate professor at the
School of Technology at University of 
Campinas. He was a postdoctoral Fellow
at the Gleb Wataghin Physics Institute
at University of Campinas where received
his Ph.D. degree in 2004. He was a
visiting student at the Nanotech
Institute at the University of Texas at 
Dallas in 2002 and 2003. He also received 
his S.M. degree in physics from University 
of Campinas in 2000, and his B.S. degree 
also in physics from University of Campinas 
in 1998. One of his research interests is 
to develop and use computational simulation
tools to study properties of nanomaterials.
He has also interests in Scientific Writing
and in Physics Education.
